Transcript: Dinah: Mom?
Vanessa: Dinah?
Dinah: What are you doing here?

Vanessa: Well, that's what I'm asking
myself. That woman at the front desk is driving me absolutely out of my mind.
Have you seen Olivia?

Dinah: No. But what are you doing here? Are
you here to pay me a visit?

Vanessa: Actually, I was going to call and surprise
you, but you caught me, so... guess who is moving back to Springfield?
Dinah: You?
Vanessa: Yes. Me and Matt, and your sister, Maureen.
Dinah: No. The hell you are. No.

Ava: You're sick. This is a joke. You
shouldn't be anyone's mother. Someone has to do something about this, and it
looks like it's gonna be me.

Coop: Hey, whoa, Ava. Hi, remember me. I'm Coop,
your boyfriend. I thought, maybe.

Ava: I'm busy. I'm late for work. I've got
to go.

Coop: Look, I left you some messages. I left
you three of them. Did you get them?
Ava: I did. Yes. But I'm late for work...

Coop: Ava, it just seems like you're trying
to... Ava, it just seems like you're trying to... wow, you have been trying to
blow me off, haven't you? Ava, what is this?
Ava: What?

Coop: What do you mean, "What."
This bruise on your arm.
Ava: I must have bumped into something.

Coop: Right, I think we both know what that
something must have been. It was Olivia, wasn't it? Ava, what the hell did she
do to you now?

Josh: I think I have a bottle of wine in the
fridge.
Cassie: And what might we be drinking to?
Josh: My new business partner.

Cassie: No, I thought we were just swinging
by here to pick up some papers. You wouldn't happen to be trying to turn this
into something more, now, would you?

Josh: You got a problem with that? Hm? I
didn't think so. It turns out I didn't have any wine, but I did find us a
couple of... hmm.

Alan: Reva, Reva, will you just let them
take care of this.

Reva: You know what you should do, is learn
to clean up your own mess.
Alan: You called us here to discuss Elizabeth’s baby, Reva.

Reva: Jonathan and Lizzie’s baby. I mean, if
you just clean it up...
Alan: Damn it, Reva, just stop it!
Billy: Whoa, take your hands off of her.
Tammy: I can't do this.
Jonathan: Can't do what?
Tammy: I love you, Jonathan.

Jonathan: But what? Are you... are you
leaving me? Are you... are you leaving me? Is that what you're saying? Are you
leaving me?

Tammy: You're married to Lizzie and you're
asking if I'm leaving you?

Jonathan: Come on, it's crazy. You know that
we're not really together.

Tammy: Yeah, of course I do. But it's too
hard for me to watch you with her, you know? And sometimes... sometimes I even
feel like...
Jonathan: Like what?

Tammy: Like I'm sneaking around with a
married man.
Jonathan: Come on.

Tammy: Look, logically I know that you are
doing the right thing for the baby, but that doesn't make it any easier for me
to take. I need space; time just to get away.
Jonathan: You need time to get away from me.

Tammy: It hurts. It hurts me to see you with
her. I know it's just an act for Alan. But I can't take it anymore.
Jonathan: What do you want?
Tammy: It's not what I want.
Jonathan: Just tell me what you want.

Tammy: It's not what I want, it's what I
need. Just until this is over.

Jonathan: I didn't even want the baby. And
you and Reva pushed me. Come on, it was your idea to live with Lizzie in the
first place.
Tammy: I know.

Jonathan: That's it? You know. We could have
been in San Francisco right now living our lives. And I would offer you
that if I could, but...

Tammy: But you can't leave your baby, I
know. You love her. I love that about you, Jonathan. I love everything about
you. That's why I can't be around.

Jonathan: So we're not really over, you just
don't ever want to see me?
Tammy: Please try to understand.

Jonathan: No, I understand. I understand
where you get this idea from-- Remy!
Remy: I'll be back in a minute.
Mel: Maybe this wasn't such a good idea.

Rick: No, no. I'm glad I'm out with my wife.
The rest of this nonsense is...

Beth: Okay, Billy, nobody needs your cowboy
justice here.
Billy: Is that a fact now?
Reva: Billy, I'm okay.

Alan: Other than being stoned out of your
gourd, Reva.

Billy: You just stay away from Reva and her
son, you got that clear?
Reva: Billy.

Billy: No, no, no. You stay away from my
family or you won't even see me coming, Alan. I've got it handled.

Alan: You know, I remember when Josh used to
issue Reva’s threats.

Billy: Yeah, well, I fight a lot dirtier
than Josh.
Alan: Is that how you took his wife?

Billy: Gee, I don't know, Alan. How did you
take your son's wife?

Alan: Reva called a meeting to bring about
family unity. And I'm glad you're here, Billy, because I want you to listen to
this. Reva, if you think you and your pot-head son are going to keep me away
from Elizabeth and her baby, you are absolutely out of your mind.
Reva: Billy, no, I... it's okay.
Billy: Just a minute...
Reva: Just... no.
Billy: Okay.
Reva: You have to get me out of here.
Billy: What's wrong?

Reva: I'm sinking, I'm sinking fast, I can
tell. I thought I could make it through that dinner, I thought I could get Alan
to back off of Jonathan, but I can’t. I don't even know if I can get out of
here, Billy. You have to help me.
Billy: Okay.

Josh: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have brought
you here. Anyplace else, but not here.
Cassie: Why, why are you apologizing?
Josh: Because.

Cassie: All you did was bring me back to
your place.

Josh: Yeah, to a place that holds a lot of
memories for me and Reva.

Cassie: Yeah, so? You're obviously finding a
way to handle it, so I can handle it, too. We're fine.
Josh: Just fine?

Cassie: We're great. If Reva is pulling for
us, then I don't know what my problem is. So... I don't know, maybe we just
need to make a few of our own memories, I think. See, now, I'm going to
remember that.

Josh: Me, too. This is good. I like this
making memories thing. We should work on this a little more.

Cassie: Okay, all right. So, I don't know,
what about over here. Do you have any particular memories right about here?

Josh: Let me think. No, no memories here.
You know what, I don't think I have any memories, honestly.

Cassie: (Laughs) Okay. What are you
waiting for?
Josh: That was too short. (Laughter) (knock on the door) Oh! Stay here, don't move. Excuse me. Okay. Hi, there.
Joe: Mr. Lewis?
Josh: Yes.

Joe: We were clearing out the WSPR
storeroom, we found something you wife might want.
Josh: Okay, she's not here right now, so...

Joe: Nice, isn't it? Tell Reva that Joe said
hi.

Josh: I will. Thank you so much. Wow, this
is really life size, don't you think?
Cassie: Why, yes, it sure is.

Josh: What... what do you think I should do
with it?
Cassie: I... I have no idea.

Josh: Okay, where were we... just a second.
(Laughter) Is that better?
Cassie: Much better.
Josh: Okay.
Cassie: (Laughing)

Dinah: You know, you decide to come here,
but you don't send me a letter, you don't make a phone call and say, "Hello,
Dinah, I'm here."

Vanessa: I don't know, I kind of thought you
would be happy.

Dinah: Well, I'm not happy because I know
why you are moving here.

Vanessa: No, you don’t. Now, Matt is going
to be working with Josh again, and I have some very nice opportunities for
myself.

Dinah: Okay, and your psychotic daughter
just broke up with her boyfriend, so therefore we should pat her down, put her
in a strait jacket, keep an eye on her because there may be hell to pay.
Vanessa: No.

Dinah: Yeah. Mom, you are here to keep an
eye on me before we go off to Europe and be on the run again, right? Because you don't
actually believe I have changed.

Vanessa: Darling, I know that you have
changed.

Dinah: Okay, then why did you set up the
intervention with Harley? Because you don't trust me, is why. Do you know how
humiliating all this has been?

Vanessa: (Sighs) I'm not moving back to Springfield to humiliate you. And that lunch with Harley was not
an intervention...
Dinah: Here you go again...
Vanessa: ...It was just a lunch.

Dinah: Let me tell you something, you're
doing the same thing you did when I was growing up. You're trying to protect me
because you put me up for adoption. You feel guilty because of that. It has
always been because of that.
Vanessa: Dinah, you make me so mad.

Dinah: Well, I'm sorry, you keep on trying
to bring the past up, trying to get those days back. Not going to happen, Mom. So
you know what, you stay out of my life, okay? Because you're only making things
worse.

Ava: I'm serious, okay? I'm late. Alan-Michael
is going to get upset.

Coop: Stop, no. You're not going anywhere
until you tell me what happened with Olivia. How did you get that bruise on
your arm?
Ava: It wasn't Olivia.
Coop: Then who was it?
Ava: It was someone else.
Coop: Who?
Ava: Someone Olivia hired.
Coop: What? She hired?

Ava: She found out we went to see Emma, and
she sent someone.
Coop: To warn you.
Ava: Something like that. Maybe, I guess so.
Coop: Please tell me you went to the cops?
Ava: Not yet.
Coop: Did you tell them? Frank, Frank!
Ava: No.
Frank: Hey, what's going on?
Coop: Either you tell him or I will.

Frank: Ava, what does my brother want you to
tell me?
Ava: There was this guy...
Frank: Go on.

Ava: Just some over- aggressive lunatic in a
pickup truck. He was tailgating me, Frank. I mean, he came this close to
hitting me. And I... I don't know, I didn't get a plate number. I was too
rattled.

Frank: Were you there, Coop? Coop, were you
there?
Coop: I wasn’t.

Frank: Okay, look, Ava, did you get a
description of the driver?

Ava: No, I didn’t. But everything is fine,
okay? Coop worries about me.

Frank: That's not necessarily a bad thing.
Listen, I tell you what, if you see that truck, you call me, all right?
Ava: Okay.

Frank: Have you heard from pop since he went
to that trade show?
Coop: No. No, I haven’t.
Frank: I'll have to call Olivia then.

Coop: Yeah, you do that. I'm sure she knows
something.

Frank: Am I missing something here? Is
everything okay between you guys?

Ava: No. I'm fine. It was just a little
scare.
Frank: Okay. I'll talk to you guys later.

Coop: Why didn't you just tell my brother
what happened, what Olivia did? Ava, how many more second chances are you going
to give her to try and kill you? Nothing is going to change.

Vanessa: You're right about one thing:
You're my child, you will always be my child, and I will always feel terrible
about the mistakes I made when I was younger.

Dinah: Oh, Mom, please stop using the past
to make me feel like I am less than sane, less than capable, less than Bill and
Maureen, the good kids, the ones you held onto.
Olivia: Hi. I'm sorry...

Vanessa: Hi. It's good to see you. Actually,
I was looking for you. Now, I called ahead to reserve for Matt and myself our
normal suite, and a woman at the front desk said it was taken.

Olivia: Oh, you know, tell her its yours.
Just tell her it's okay with me.
Vanessa: Thank you.
Olivia: You're welcome.

Vanessa: Thank you for your help. I'm not
moving back to Springfield because you broke up with Mallet. And I'm very sorry
that you did. But it is very painful to find out that you're not the center of
the universe.

Dinah: Mothers: Does anyone get along with
them?
Olivia: Not you, I guess.

Dinah: She drives me crazy. Actually, "Drives
me" aren't the right words because she already thinks I'm certifiable.
Olivia: Does she?
Dinah: Yeah, sometimes.

Olivia: Is that because you're adopted. It's
a strange thing. I was standing there and I heard. Can I ask you something? Did
it make you angry when you found out? I mean, did you want to get back at her
when you knew she gave you away?

Dinah: Whoa, whoa, whoa, why all the
questions?

Olivia: I just need to know. I need to know
if, you know, deep down you still hate her.

Billy: Reva, take a deep breath, okay? You
okay?

Reva: I'm great, if you're a twin. Are you?
No, you're not. I'm so dizzy. So much for getting high.
Billy: Wait a minute. You smoked pot?
Reva: Yeah, dad. Am I grounded?
Billy: Yeah, for at least a year.

Reva: I don't have a year. And if you don't
get me out of here, I'm going to get sick and then everybody is going to know
there is something wrong with me.
Billy: Okay, well, can you stand?
Reva: Barely.
Billy: Well, I could carry you?

Reva: Yeah, and you might as well put a big
sign on my back that says "Got cancer."

Billy: Let me just think about this for a
second.

Reva: I just thought that I could get Alan
to back off Jonathan, but I couldn't even get that right.

Billy: You can't do everything... I got it,
I got it. Just wait right here. I hate to break up the party, but Reva’s going
home. She's had just a little too much, lately. And I don't care for the way
you negotiate. So if you want to mess with Jonathan and Lizzie, then you're
going to be messing with me. How do you like those terms?
Alan: You got a white horse in the garage, Billy?
Reva: Are you fighting with Alan again?
Billy: Not as much as I'd like to.

Reva: Stop being so overprotective. Alan and
I understand each other.

Billy: Well, good, 'cause you're going home.
I got your purse.

Lizzie: No, wait, she can't go. She has to
talk to my granddad. It's important.

Billy: I'm sorry. Bad timing, darling. We're
going home. We are just a little too full of yourselves.
Reva: No, Billy. Don't make me leave.
Billy: Here we go.
Reva: Thanks. You're a genius.
Billy: Three steps now. Let's go.

Tammy: This is not about Remy. Remy has
nothing to do with this.

Jonathan: Oh, well, no. Lately it seems like
everything has something to do with Remy.
Tammy: Remy is my friend.

Jonathan: Oh, come on, Tammy. He wants to be
more than just your friend. You can see that.

Tammy: I can see that he is one of the only
things I have had to hold onto lately. God, being with the Bauer’s is like being
on vacation. They're normal and they're real. And we are not that.
Jonathan: So what are we? Come on, tell me.

Tammy: We don't play football or have
barbecues or... we can't even walk into a restaurant together. It's just easier
if we don't see each other at all.

Jonathan: It's easier? (Sobbing) I don't
know. I don't know. I don't know what I'm going to do if I can't see you. I
don't know if I can do that.

Tammy: I feel the same way. But this is
harder this way. Just stealing moments in rooms or somewhere. I mean, look at
where we are right now, Jonathan. This is crazy.

Jonathan: No, it's not crazy. Anything that
gets me close to you is not crazy. If we can just spend time together, if we
can be together. Come on.

Tammy: No, I'm sorry. I can’t. Don't, don’t.
I can’t.
Mandy Bruno, "Inside The Light"...

Marina: Well, Shayne liked baseball and Danny
liked the mob. Shane and Marina were a young and passionate love. Marina grew up a lot with Danny. And he helped
her become more of a woman. I think Marina changes with every man that she is with.
See Marina, Wednesday, October 11, "Inside The Light."
Jonathan: Where's Reva?
Beth: Billy took her home.
Jonathan: Why?
Alan: She probably had to clean her pipe.
Lizzie: Granddad, stop.

Alan: Elizabeth, your husband has been gone
20 minutes because he's stoned. And his mother was such a mess they had to take
her home. Now, if anyone is being disrespectful...
Beth: Alan, let's just eat our meals.

Alan: What did you hope to accomplish tonight,
Jonathan? Your mother was an embarrassment, and so are you. Hello, hello, I'm
talking to you. Did you hear a word I said?
Jonathan: No.
Remy: So, where'd you go?
Tammy: I just had something to take care of.

Rick: Is everything all right, Tammy? Is
there anything I can do for you?

Tammy: I'm okay. I just might go home a
little early.
Remy: Well, I'll drive.

Rick: No, you guys stay here. I don't want
to ruin your evening.

Remy: Ruin my evening? You leave me here
with these two?
Rick: Hey.
Mel: Yeah, hey.
Rick: Hey, hey, hey.

Remy: Listen, I hate married couples. You
can't strand me here. I break out. I do.
Tammy: Okay, I'll stay. Until dessert.
Remy: Okay. Of course.
Lizzie: Hey, where are you going?
Jonathan: Don't worry about it.

Beth: If you're going to be married to my
daughter, the least you can do is show her some respect.

Jonathan: Respect, respect, respect. Is that
the only word you Spaulding’s know?
Beth: You have ignored her all night.
Jonathan: I don't have time for this.
Beth: You better make time.

Rick: So while you were away, Remy was
expressing that he's a little insecure because he thinks you don't like his
cologne. So, he'd like to overcompensate by buying dinner for everyone tonight.
Remy: I don't think so. I'm a cop.
Mel: (Laughs) This is true.

Beth: My daughter has had a lousy life. She
deserves a hell of a lot better than you.
Jonathan: I agree. I wish she found him.

Beth: Well, she didn’t. So for now, she
stuck with you. And while she is, the least you can do is pretend that she is
the best thing that ever happened to you.
Jonathan: Or what?
Beth: Push me and you'll find out.

Remy: You know what, it's the other way
around, okay? They're always plying me. Rick?
Rick: Excuse me.

Jonathan: You don't want to do this with me,
Beth. Trust me.
Beth: Lizzie is carrying your child.
Jonathan: Yeah, I know.

Beth: Then act like it. Stop treating her
like dirt.
Rick: What's going on? What's going on?
Jonathan: Gang's all here.
Rick: Is this about Lizzie?
Jonathan: None of your business.

Rick: If this concerns Lizzie, it is my
business. She is the daughter of two of my dearest friends.

Jonathan: Um, friends. Hear that, Beth? You
just got downgraded from "Lover."

Billy: Well, we could go see a Cheech and Chong
movie.

Reva: I smoked the pot because I wasn't
feeling so good today.

Billy: Oh, I see. Get high, and then go out
to dinner with Alan Spaulding.

Reva: Okay, it wasn't one of my better
ideas. I was just trying to get him to back off Jonathan so he can be with his
baby and with Tammy.

Billy: Darling, you can't fix everybody's
problems.
Reva: I can try.
Billy: (Laughs)
Reva: Let's go. I want to go home.
Billy: Yeah.
Josh: Hey, guys.
Billy: Hey.
Josh: What's going on?
Reva: We were...

Billy: ...Going to the movies. As a matter
of fact, I think it's time we went in, don't you?

Josh: Do you have a second? Because I was
sort of thinking, um...
Billy: Thinking what?
Josh: Well, about you getting married.
Reva: Okay.

Josh: Are you going to live in that hotel
room forever?

Reva: We hadn't really given it much
thought, have we?
Josh: I have an idea.

Coop: Do me a favor, see this guy right over
here?
Ava: Yes.

Coop: Well, what about him? This guy, you
see him?
Ava: Yes.

Coop: I want you to tell me how you know
that these guys right here are not here to grab you at this moment.

Ava: Because Olivia thinks that I have
reported her. She is too smart to try anything now.
Coop: Really?
Ava: Really.
Coop: You really believe that?

Ava: I really believe that. I am not ready
to go to the police. If Frank sees this bruise, he's going to go after Olivia
and I'm going to lose all control.

Coop: Control of what, Ava? Olivia tried to
run you down and you didn't do a darn thing about it. Then she hired a hit man
to try and take you out. And again, you do nothing about it. Now, I want to
know why. Does this have something to do with Emma? Is that what this is about?
Or are you just too scared for her that she may lose her mother and you would
rather die.

Ava: You just have to trust me. Okay, I know
what I'm doing. Olivia can't surprise me anymore. I know everything there is to
know about her.

Dinah: So why are you assuming that I hated
my mother?

Olivia: So you're saying you didn't? I mean,
that's good. Maybe there is a part of you that knew there's a reason, a good
reason why she would give you up.
Dinah: Tell me why you're asking me this?

Olivia: I want to get to know you better.
But I'm curious, I have to admit. So, were you lonely as a kid growing up?
Dinah: Yeah, I felt lonely at times.
Olivia: I'm sorry.
Dinah: Why are you sorry?

Olivia: I'm sorry because it sound like it
was hard. And it must have been even harder when you met Vanessa. Was it?

Dinah: What are we really talking about
here?

Olivia: Emma has a classmate who was
adopted, and her parents are about to sit her down and tell her. And I just
wonder what they're faced with.

Dinah: Well, Emma is... three? You're being
awfully thorough.

Olivia: I kind of have to be, Dinah.
Because, you know... you never know, this girl can grow up to have emotional
issues.
Dinah: And shoot her fiancée like I did.

Olivia: No, that's not what I mean. I
just... just a sense of rage, maybe wishing she had never been told.

Dinah: I've never really been the suspicious
type. Actually, I take that back. But this stuff about Emma’s adopted friend is
a little lame. So why don't you really tell me why you're asking me these
questions?

Olivia: You don't have to believe me, but
I'm curious. Why are you so suspicious of everyone and everything? (Knock on
the door) Excuse me.

Vanessa: Hi. I just wanted to thank you
again. The front desk took care of everything.
Olivia: No problem. You're welcome.

Vanessa: Yes. And I will try and stay out of
your way, Dinah.

Dinah: Wait, Mom. Olivia, thank you very
much for the drink.
Olivia: You're welcome.

Dinah: I'd like to apologize, I was a jerk
before. Do you forgive me?
Vanessa: Maybe.

Dinah: Come on, Mom. I'm sorry. I just... I
overreacted a little bit because of Mallet, okay? I admit it. But I shouldn't
have gone off on you like that. And I know that you didn't move to town to spy
on me. Did you?
Vanessa: Do I look like James Bond?

Dinah: You know, next time I talk to you
like that, you can kick me.
Vanessa: Well, if you insist.

Dinah: But you wouldn't because you love me.
Come here, Mom. You love me, right?
Vanessa: I love you very much.

Dinah: Oh, good, good. Now, listen, this is
very exciting. You're going to see me every day now.
Vanessa: Every day?
Dinah: Yeah, count on it. Every day.
Vanessa: (Laughs) Wow!
Dinah: Yeah.

Ava: I am capable of handling Olivia my own
way.

Coop: So I guess I shouldn't be expecting a
phone call saying that they found your body lying in a ditch somewhere. I feel
much better now. Thanks.

Ava: No, Coop, please. I know this isn't
easy for you. It isn't easy for me, either. But I don't go around looking for
enemies like Olivia. If she wants to fight, I'll fight.

Coop: That's the problem. Ava, if you wanted
to fight, you would have told Frank, but your not.
Ava: I'm keeping it in my pocket.

Coop: Come on. Just do it. All right? Turn Olivia
in. Get her away from Emma. I want to know, who is Olivia to you that makes her
deserve so much of a break, so much respect?

Ava: She's no one. And after what she's done
to me, she will never be anything-- never. And I can promise you that much.

Josh: So, I've been thinking a lot today
about Cross Creek, and about how I had it moved here, to Springfield for you, and how ever since things have ended
between us, I've been living there by default. But it was my gift for you, and
I still want you to have it.
Reva: I... I can’t.
Josh: Well, you need a place to live, right?

Reva: Not at Cross Creek. It's your family's
home.

Josh: Well, Billy’s part of my family and
it's his home, too, and I think you should be there. Right?

Cassie: I don't want you to make a decision
that you'll be sorry about later.

Josh: I won't be sorry about it. So, I'll
tell you what. I'm going to have my lawyers draw up the papers and get them to
you. Consider it a wedding gift to both of you. And don't try to talk me out of
it, okay, because it's not a good idea. We'll see you around. Let's go.

Cassie: Um, you don’t... you don't have to
do this.

Josh: I kind of think I do. I mean, I'll
always have memories of Reva and our time together, but they need to stay
exactly that, just memories of the past.
Billy: You okay?
Reva: I want to go home. But not Cross Creek.
Billy: Okay, come on.

Rick: I don't know where this is going, but
it's just unnecessary. So why don't we just do this. Why don't we just chill
out, take a deep breath, calm down, go back to our tables and enjoy the rest of
our meal.

Jonathan: Chill out. Good. It's good advice,
Rick.
Tammy: Jonathan, why are you doing this?

Jonathan: Why am I doing this? Because I'm
walking across the room to see you, and Beth assaults me.

Tammy: I asked you to keep your distance.
Stay away from our table. We are trying to have a nice, normal dinner.

Jonathan: Oh, nice, normal. You never got
that from me, right? Right? You want to see how nice and normal these people
really are?
Tammy: What are you talking about?
Rick: Where you going?

Jonathan: Hey, everybody, gather around!
I've got something to say and it's gonna be really good!

Coop: Before you go anywhere, I just want to
know that you have a plan to deal with this, that's all.

Ava: You're just going to have to wait and
see.
Coop: Okay. You going to shoot Olivia?
Ava: No.
Coop: Stab her?
Ava: Coop.
